thread.title: Detroit News predictions: Michigan State vs. Rutgers
thread.title_full: Detroit News predictions: Michigan State vs. Rutgers

author: detroitnews.com
title: Detroit News predictions: Michigan State vs. Rutgers
text:
Michigan State is guarded against any letdown. (Photo: Dale G. Young, Detroit News) 
CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Matt Charboneau, Angelique S. Chengelis, Bob Wojnowski and John Niyo offer their predictions on Saturday's Michigan State-Rutgers game.
Matt Charboneau: Michigan State has been seeking a complete performance all season and Rutgers just might be the perfect opponent. Rutgers has shown it can move the ball at times, but the defense has been abysmal at times and the Michigan State offense needs to break out before it heads to Michigan next week. This should be the game it all comes together. Michigan State 38-10 
Angelique S. Chengelis: Michigan State has been dealing with injuries and a scare against Purdue last Saturday. Michigan State will re-focus and will avoid looking ahead to its opponent next week, Michigan. On the road at Rutgers isn’t going to provide another scare. Michigan State 35-21 
Bob Wojnowski: This looks like a softie, but the Spartans haven’t exactly been squishing the softies. Rutgers gets WR Leonte Carroo back from suspension, and you can bet he’ll challenge Michigan State’s suspect secondary. The Scarlet Knights have been a disaster, but this is their chance for a perception-changer in prime time. The Spartans can’t overlook anyone, and I think they know it. Michigan State 34-20 
John Niyo: Rutgers had a week off, but the Scarlet Knights are still without their coach and they’ve yet to a face a team that resembles Michigan State. This probably won’t be the rout it was a year ago, but it’s a good chance for the Spartans to quiet some of their critics with a runaway win. Michigan State 38-13
